verses.verse: To the chief Musician <WH5329> for the sons <WH1121> of Korah <WH7141>, Maschil <WH4905>. We have heard <WH8085> with our ears <WH241>, O God <WH430>, our fathers <WH1> have told <WH5608> us, what work <WH6467> thou didst <WH6466> in their days <WH3117>, in the times <WH3117> of old <WH6924>.
How thou didst drive out <WH3423> the heathen <WH1471> with thy hand <WH3027>, and plantedst <WH5193> them; how thou didst afflict <WH7489> the people <WH3816>, and cast them out <WH7971>.

For they got <WH3423> not the land <WH776> in possession <WH3423> by their own sword <WH2719>, neither did their own arm <WH2220> save <WH3467> them: but thy right hand <WH3225>, and thine arm <WH2220>, and the light <WH216> of thy countenance <WH6440>, because thou hadst a favour <WH7521> unto them.
Thou art my King <WH4428>, O God <WH430>: command <WH6680> deliverances <WH3444> for Jacob <WH3290>.
Through thee will we push down <WH5055> our enemies <WH6862>: through thy name <WH8034> will we tread them under <WH947> that rise up <WH6965> against us.
For I will not trust <WH982> in my bow <WH7198>, neither shall my sword <WH2719> save <WH3467> me.
But thou hast saved <WH3467> us from our enemies <WH6862>, and hast put them to shame <WH954> that hated <WH8130> us.
In God <WH430> we boast <WH1984> all the day <WH3117> long, and praise <WH3034> thy name <WH8034> for ever <WH5769>. Selah <WH5542>.
But <WH637> thou hast cast off <WH2186>, and put us to shame <WH3637>; and goest not forth <WH3318> with our armies <WH6635>.
Thou makest us to turn <WH7725> back <WH268> from the enemy <WH6862>: and they which hate <WH8130> us spoil <WH8154> for themselves.
Thou hast given <WH5414> us like sheep <WH6629> appointed for meat <WH3978>; and hast scattered <WH2219> us among the heathen <WH1471>.
Thou sellest <WH4376> thy people <WH5971> for nought <WH1952>, and dost not increase <WH7235> thy wealth by their price <WH4242>.
Thou makest <WH7760> us a reproach <WH2781> to our neighbours <WH7934>, a scorn <WH3933> and a derision <WH7047> to them that are round about <WH5439> us.
Thou makest <WH7760> us a byword <WH4912> among the heathen <WH1471>, a shaking <WH4493> of the head <WH7218> among the people <WH3816>.
My confusion <WH3639> is continually <WH3117> before me, and the shame <WH1322> of my face <WH6440> hath covered <WH3680> me,
For the voice <WH6963> of him that reproacheth <WH2778> and blasphemeth <WH1442>; by reason <WH6440> of the enemy <WH341> and avenger <WH5358>.
All this is come <WH935> upon us; yet have we not forgotten <WH7911> thee, neither have we dealt falsely <WH8266> in thy covenant <WH1285>.
Our heart <WH3820> is not turned <WH5472> back <WH268>, neither have our steps <WH838> declined <WH5186> from thy way <WH734>;
Though thou hast sore broken <WH1794> us in the place <WH4725> of dragons <WH8577>, and covered <WH3680> us with the shadow of death <WH6757>.
If we have forgotten <WH7911> the name <WH8034> of our God <WH430>, or stretched out <WH6566> our hands <WH3709> to a strange <WH2114> god <WH410>;
Shall not God <WH430> search this out <WH2713>? for he knoweth <WH3045> the secrets <WH8587> of the heart <WH3820>.
Yea, for thy sake are we killed <WH2026> all the day <WH3117> long; we are counted <WH2803> as sheep <WH6629> for the slaughter <WH2878>.
Awake <WH5782>, why sleepest <WH3462> thou, O Lord <WH136>? arise <WH6974>, cast us not off <WH2186> for ever <WH5331>.
Wherefore hidest <WH5641> thou thy face <WH6440>, and forgettest <WH7911> our affliction <WH6040> and our oppression <WH3906>?
For our soul <WH5315> is bowed down <WH7743> to the dust <WH6083>: our belly <WH990> cleaveth <WH1692> unto the earth <WH776>.
Arise <WH6965> for our help <WH5833>, and redeem <WH6299> us for thy mercies' <WH2617> sake.
